alert.note: Alert for Cullman; DeKalb; Jackson; Madison; Marshall; Morgan (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 10:25PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Clusters of strong thunderstorms producing torrential rainfall will continue from Cullman northeastward to South Pittsburg through 1115 PM CST... At 1022 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near South Pittsburg to near Cullman. Movement was east at 10 mph. The training nature of these thunderstorms will result in excessive rainfall rates and an increasing risk for flooding. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 30 MPH, pea size hail and flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Significant ponding of water on roads and minor flooding are also possible. Locations impacted include... Albertville, Cullman, Scottsboro, Boaz, Guntersville, Arab, Rainsville, Bridgeport, Henagar, and Good Hope. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for north central and northeastern Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Cullman; DeKalb; Jackson; Madison; Marshall; Morgan
